result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Jurgenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Joint/Several restitution; to be paid at monthly rate TBD by agent.

No possession of dangerous weapons. 

No contact with Mill's Fleet Farm in Wausau.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.  

51 days jail credit, IF revoked from probation.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

timeConds.notes: No objection to EMP. Huber for child care if approved by jail.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Jurgenson

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:55 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person with Atty John Wallace. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
Ct. 3 (Theft/PTAC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
Ct. 3>>SWH for 1 yr probation - ADDITIONAL CONDITION: 12 months MCJ - no objection to EMP (Court finds it appropriate for job search). 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS ON BOTH>>Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no possession of dangerous weapons; no contact with Mill's Fleet Farm in Wausau; joint and several restitution with TM of $6886.87 plus 10% surcharge to be paid at monthly rate TBD by agent; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 

COURT finds the def entitled to 51 days jail credit if revoked. 

COURT notes no objection to jail in Br. 5 revocation case being ordered to run CONCURRENT to conditional jail in this case. 
State will be allowed to request restitution hrg if additional restitution is requested. 
Adj: 3:13 pm

No contact with victim(s): Mill's Fleet Farm in Wausau.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No contact with Co-Deft Tyrese Merriam. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
